page.title: 09ROYAL NAVAL DOCKYARD
page.content: The Royal Naval Dockyard employs approximately 13,000 people. These people repair and refit the{ships}in the Dockyard. There is a frigate complex which can hold three frigates during refit. After they have been refitted they will undergo tests in a special basin. There is a weekend annually in August called "Navy Days" when members of the public can look over the Dockyard, ships and submarines. Some places, including the latest nuclear{submarines,}are sometimes out of bounds for security reasons. The Dockyard played a major part in the Falklands conflict, converting liners into troop carriers. Many men work shifts. There is concern at the moment over Government plans to privatise the Yard. Some people say that 2000 jobs will be lost.
